item.title: Two Simple Java Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Okay, but this is just copy & paste. If you want to help people, you should start by explaining the Basics, which excludes date… Just explain Strings, ints, booleans, (shorts, floats). What static/final/private/public/protected/etc means. And how to use these. Also include statements, methods, subclasesses and stuff. That would be much better.

~Supamagier

PS: You learn Java better if you explain all you know by heart, instead of using a guide, that helps you to remember things better.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Simple Java Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @supernovadelta supernovadelta
item.description:
@supernovadelta wrote:

[center]Two Simple Java Tutorials.[/center]
[size=11pt]Purpose:[/size]Simple Copy And Paste For You,Nothing Realy For You To Do.

[center]Tutorial 1[/center]
Obtaining a Date Object From a String
Here is the simple code:

import java.text.DateFormat; import java.util.Date; import java.util.Locale; public class MainClass { public static void main(String[] a) { Date aDate; DateFormat fmt = DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, Locale.US); try { aDate = fmt.parse("Saturday, July 4, 1998 "); System.out.println("The Date string is: " + fmt.format(aDate)); } catch (java.text.ParseException e) { System.out.println(e); } } }
The Import part will extract the interior base and create a CLASS.file
Compile and use this as a source code also.

[center]Tutorial 2[/center]
Boolean Variables
[center]1.Variables of type boolean can have only one of two values, true or false.
2.The values ‘true’ and ‘false’ are boolean literals.
[/center]
Here is a basic code,refering Boolean.

[code]public class MainClass{

public static void main(String[] arg){
boolean state = true;
state = false;
System.out.println(state);
}
}
[/code]
As you have noticed the TRUE and FALSE.

There will be more tutorials coming soon.
If there is any questions,i will be happy to provide additional help.
Thank you for your time.

Read full topic
